alert.note: Alert for Allen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 6:39PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EST/745 PM CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and southwest Michigan, including the following counties, in Indiana, Allen IN, Cass IN, De Kalb, Elkhart, Fulton IN, Kosciusko, La Porte, Lagrange, Marshall, Miami, Noble, Pulaski, St. Joseph, Starke, Steuben, Wabash, White and Whitley. In southwest Michigan, Berrien, Cass MI and St. Joseph MI. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EST /745 PM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Road ponding will also be likely which can make travel hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM EST /537 PM CST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Wayne, South Bend, Elkhart, Mishawaka, Goshen, Michigan City, La Porte, Warsaw, Auburn, Niles, Sturgis, Benton Harbor, Plymouth, Kendallville, Columbia City, Angola, St. Joseph, Three Rivers, Nappanee and Garrett. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
